verses.chant_yoruba: Eji Ogbe dakun, mo wa gbe o. O nini, o nini, o nini...
verses.translation: Eji Ogbe please, I have come to praise you. The possessor of all things...
verses.message: This Odu signifies absolute victory, light, and awakening. The client is entering a period of unhindered success.
verses.prescription: Offer water and kolanut to Ori (Destiny).

verses.translation: Darkness swirls, but wisdom prevents death...
verses.message: This Odu warns of endings or separation but offers strong protection if the ancestors are appeased.
verses.prescription: Feed the Elders of the Night (Iyaami) and seek ancestral blessings.

verses.message: A time of careful examination. Things are not what they seem. Look deeper before making a decision.
verses.prescription: Use Shea Butter (Ori) to cool the head.

verses.message: This Odu speaks of strong protection and fertility. Your boundaries are secure, but ensure you do not isolate yourself.
verses.prescription: Offerings to Esu are vital to open the gate.
